description:
An open-source alternative to Claude Cowork, powered by OpenCode

OpenWork is an extensible, open-source “Claude Work” style system for knowledge workers.
It’s a native desktop app that runs OpenCode under the hood, but presents it as a clean, guided workflow:
- pick a workspace
- start a run
- watch progress + plan updates
- approve permissions when needed
- reuse what works (templates + skills)
The goal: make “agentic work” feel like a product, not a terminal.
Highlights
- Redesigned the Skills experience around a character-first worker capabilities layout for clearer discovery and configuration.
- Improved owpenbot identity handling by scoping workspace agents and separating advanced identity controls.
Fixes & polish
- Included follow-up compatibility and stability updates across app/session/workspace contexts and server wiring.
- Synced package versions, lockfiles, and desktop metadata for the 0.11.60 release.
Packaging / ops
- Updated AUR packaging metadata for the prior patch line as part of the release train.
